result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Michael Hardy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad Michael Hardy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chad Michael Hardy was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Failure to pay will be one day in jail for every $50 or part thereof that remains unpaid with Huber consecutive to any other time being served (so long as DE reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Notification - Vacated by Green County Court Personnel.  Paperwork from Green County Clerk of Courts

Installment Payment Agreement for Fine or Forfeiture.
Pay $50.00 per month beginning 8-15-16.  Failure to pay will be one day in jail for every $30 or part thereof that remains unpaid with Huber consecutive to any other time being served.

Chad Michael Hardy, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Online payment on july 2 did not come in until July 8. Paid in good faith, is now up to date. No objection to reinstatement of payment plan. Payments to be moved to the 15th of every month.
Confirmation of Fax to GCSD of Amended Commitment Order dated 7-12-16.
Amended Commitment Order for the New Amount of $495.00.  (For on 7-12-16 received a pymt from the Payment Processing Center of $60.00.) (Sent copy to GCSD & Brodhead Police Dept. & Chad Hardy)
Canceled warrant for he paid $60.00 and will reissue an Amended Warrant for the new amount due.
Notification - Vacated by Green County Circuit Court Personnel

Installment Payment Agreement for Fine or Forfeiture.
Pay $50  per month beginning May 4, 2016.  Failure to pay will be one day in jail for every $50 or part thereof that remains unpaid with Huber consecutive to any other time being served.

Chad Michael Hardy, defendant appeared in Court in person without counsel.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Chad Michael Hardy, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant pleas no contest to count 2, count 1 dismissed on prosecutor's motion. Elements and Plea Questionaire/Waiver of Rights received by court.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Chad Michael Hardy, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.

Violation: DC (DV); Ressiting an officer
Issuing Agency: Brodhead Police Department
Conditions:  May not possess or consume any intoxicants.  No violent or abusive contact with: L.L.H. (upon the no contact is waived or expired). NO CONTACT WITH: L.L.H, the victim. No contact with residence at:106 21st St, #87, Brodhead, WI. until 11/11/15 at 10:45pm unless the defendant is contacted by the Brodhead Police Department. May go to the residence one time to pick up personal belongings if accompanied by a Brodhead police officer.

Chad Michael Hardy, defendant appeared in Court in custody by video with counsel Guy M. Taylor. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Signature bond set at $1,000; Conditions:  May not possess or consume any intoxicants.  No violent or abusive contact with: L.L.H. -upon the no contact is waived or expired. NO CONTACT WITH: L.L.H, the victim. No contact with residence at:106 21st St, #87, Brodhead, WI. until 11/11/15 at 10:45pm unless the defendant is contacted by the Brodhead Police Department. May go to the residence one time to pick up personal belongings if accompanied by a Brodhead police officer. Defendant waives speedy trial. Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
